subject: Business
title: Cognitive Biases in Leadership Decisions
description: A short lesson to help you apply Cognitive Biases in Leadership Decisions.

hook.text: A CEO doubles down on a failing project because they personally championed it. Ego overrides evidence.

buildup.text: Leaders are subject to the same biases as everyone: confirmation bias, sunk cost fallacy, overconfidence.

discovery.text: Confirmation bias is the deadliest: leaders seek data supporting their view and dismiss contradicting evidence.

twist.text: Seniority makes bias worse. Nobody challenges the CEO. The higher you rise, the less honest feedback you get.

climax.text: Amazon's 'disagree and commit' culture forces dissent into the open before decisions are made.

punchline.text: The biggest risk isn't being wrong. It's never hearing that you are.

quiz.question: Why do cognitive biases get worse with seniority?
options: Fewer people are willing to challenge a senior leader's views
